subject: Tests and Testing
Doping (Sports)
Tour de France (Bicycle Race)
lead_paragraph: Lance Armstrong said he thought French doping officials would bar him from this year’s Tour de France because of a report that he violated protocols during a recent drug test. In a video statement on his Web site, Armstrong said there was a “very high likelihood” he would not be allowed to race for an eighth Tour de France title. The French drug testing agency has said it could punish Armstrong, who said the drug tests came back negative.
